snippet: American officials said they had evidence that hostages taken by Syrian rebels were members of Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps, not pilgrims as described by the government in Tehran.
abstract: American officials say they have obtained credible evidence that at least some of the 48 Iranians captured in Damascus by Syrian rebels were members of Iran's elite Islamic Revolutionary Guards corp, not the pilgrims described by the government in Tehran.

byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and DAMIEN CAVE
byline.contributor: Thom Shanker reported from Washington, and Damien Cave from Beirut, Lebanon. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: American officials said they had evidence that hostages taken by Syrian rebels were members of Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps, not pilgrims as described by the government in Tehran.

headline.seo: Iran Revolutionary Guards Among Syrian Hostages, U.S. Says
headline.main: Syrian Rebels Said to Be Holding Elite Fighters From Iran
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Said to Hold Elite Fighters From Iran
